message: I am building my first django site and want to add some of that web sharing goodness. My question is whether all these apps work well together or if there is overlapping functionality I am missing. Has anyone used these successfully or should I be trying a different angle? Any insight would be appreciated as this stuff is all very new to me. Thanks
i got that far ok, but now i am trying to work with OpenID and OAuth and things are getting trickier
django-registration and django-profiles are designed to work together
wondering if im moving in the right direction or not so much
i haven't used registration, but social-auth gives you plain old contrib.auth Users, so i would think it's a compatible replacement
@silverlock said they do work well together in this other thread: https://convore.com/django-community/any-good-django-app-for-twitterfacebook-classic-auth-ala-convore-to-advise/259967/
seems like there are all sorts of apps people are using, good stuff
thanks, this is probably a good time to look into the pinax project then
a couple of pinax's starter project basically do the equivalent, all integrated with starter templates
it provides registration and authorization via Facebook, Twitter, OpenID stuff
@thesteve my advice is use django-socialregistration either my fork https://github.com/amakhnach/django-socialregistration or another
thanks, i will take a look at it
@omab no, django-oauth-access and pinax's account app
